## BUSINESS PROFILE

### Company Information
Name: TIGON Neighborhood Electric Vehicles
Short Name: TIGON NEV
Industry: Neighborhood Electric Vehicle Sales, Service, and Rentals
Founded: 2015
Business Type: Authorized NEV Dealership
Website: https://tigonnev.com
Email: info@tigonnev.com
Phone: 1-844-844-6638

### Business Description
TIGON NEV is North America's premier neighborhood electric vehicle dealership, specializing in DENAGO and EVOLUTION electric vehicles. We provide comprehensive sales, service, rental, and financing solutions for customers seeking eco-friendly, street-legal transportation alternatives.

### Brands Represented
Primary Brands:
- DENAGO Electric Vehicles
- EVOLUTION Electric Vehicles

### Service Areas
States Served: Pennsylvania, New Jersey, Delaware, Virginia, Maryland, North Carolina, South Carolina, Florida, Indiana, Ohio, New York
International: Canada, Mexico
Total Locations: 30 (18 physical showrooms + 12 online stores)

Key Markets:
- Hatfield, Pennsylvania (Headquarters)
- Ocean View, New Jersey
- Pocono Pines, Pennsylvania
- Philadelphia Metro Area
- New York Metro Area
- Mid-Atlantic Region

## COMPLETE VEHICLE INVENTORY FOR AI TRAINING

### DENAGO Vehicle Models

#### DENAGO EV City
Type: 2-Passenger Street-Legal NEV
Top Speed: 25 mph
Range: Up to 40 miles per charge
Seating: 2 passengers
Battery: Lithium-ion
Motor: Electric AC motor
Features: LED lights, USB charging ports, rear cargo area, street-legal package
Use Cases: Urban commuting, campus transportation, neighborhood travel
Price Range: $8,000 - $12,000
Target Market: City commuters, college campuses, retirement communities

#### DENAGO EV Nomad
Type: 4-Passenger Off-Road Capable NEV
Top Speed: 25 mph
Range: Up to 50 miles per charge
Seating: 4 passengers
Battery: 48V Lithium-ion
Terrain: Mixed terrain capable
Features: All-terrain tires, lifted suspension, LED light package, Bluetooth audio
Use Cases: Golf courses, resort properties, light trail riding
Price Range: $12,000 - $16,000

#### DENAGO EV Nomad XL
Type: 6-Passenger Extended Range NEV
Top Speed: 25 mph
Range: Up to 60 miles per charge
Seating: 6 passengers (3 rows)
Battery: Extended capacity lithium-ion
Features: Extended roof, rear-facing seats, premium sound system
Use Cases: Large families, hospitality, tour operations
Price Range: $15,000 - $19,000

#### DENAGO EV Rover XL
Type: 4-Passenger Utility NEV
Top Speed: 25 mph
Range: Up to 55 miles per charge
Seating: 4 passengers + cargo bed
Payload: 800 lbs cargo capacity
Features: Dump bed, tow hitch, work lights, tool storage
Use Cases: Landscaping, property maintenance, farm work
Price Range: $14,000 - $18,000

#### DENAGO EV Rover XL6
Type: 6-Passenger Utility NEV
Top Speed: 25 mph
Range: Up to 50 miles per charge
Seating: 6 passengers + cargo bed
Payload: 600 lbs cargo capacity
Features: Extended bed, dual bench seating, enhanced suspension
Use Cases: Family transport with cargo needs, commercial applications
Price Range: $16,000 - $20,000

#### DENAGO EV Rover XXL
Type: Heavy-Duty Utility NEV
Top Speed: 25 mph
Range: Up to 45 miles per charge
Payload: 1,200 lbs cargo capacity
Features: Reinforced chassis, industrial-grade tires, commercial package
Use Cases: Commercial landscaping, construction sites, industrial facilities
Price Range: $18,000 - $25,000

### EVOLUTION Vehicle Models

#### EVOLUTION D5 Maverick
Type: 4-Passenger Luxury NEV
Top Speed: 25 mph
Range: Up to 50 miles per charge
Seating: 4 passengers
Features: Premium upholstery, advanced dashboard, smartphone integration, climate control
Use Cases: Resort communities, luxury neighborhoods, executive transport
Price Range: $14,000 - $18,000

#### EVOLUTION Carrier 6 Plus
Type: 6-Passenger People Mover
Top Speed: 25 mph
Range: Up to 55 miles per charge
Seating: 6 passengers (stadium seating)
Features: Easy entry/exit, safety package, LED lighting, weather enclosure
Use Cases: Hotels, airports, large property transport, tour operations
Price Range: $16,000 - $21,000

- New NEV sales (DENAGO & EVOLUTION)
- Custom vehicle configurations
- Trade-in evaluations

- Vehicle demonstrations
- Fleet sales (commercial/municipal)

- Annual maintenance packages
- Battery diagnostics and replacement
- Motor servicing
- Brake system maintenance
- Tire replacement and rotation
- Electrical system diagnostics
- Body and paint repair
- Custom modifications
- Warranty service

### Rental Services
- Daily rentals
- Weekly rentals
- Monthly rentals
- Seasonal rentals
- Event rentals
- Corporate rentals
- Try-before-you-buy programs

### Financing Options
- 0% APR financing available (qualified buyers)
- Flexible payment plans (12-60 months)
- Lease-to-own programs
- Commercial fleet financing
- Trade-in credit programs

## TECHNICAL SPECIFICATIONS DATABASE

### Battery Technology
- Lithium-ion battery systems
- 48V and 72V configurations
- Charge time: 6-8 hours (standard), 2-4 hours (fast charge)
- Battery life: 3-5 years typical
- Replacement cost: $1,500 - $3,500
- Warranty: 2-3 years manufacturer warranty

### Motor Specifications
- AC electric motors
- Power output: 3.5 HP - 7.5 HP
- Torque: High torque at low RPM
- Maintenance: Minimal (brushless design)
- Efficiency: 90%+ energy conversion

### Charging Infrastructure
- Standard 110V household outlet compatible
- 220V fast charging available
- Solar panel compatibility
- Public charging station compatible
- Portable charger included

## REGULATORY COMPLIANCE FOR AI LEARNING

### Street Legal Requirements
- Low Speed Vehicle (LSV) classification
- 25 mph maximum speed
- DOT-approved safety features
- Required equipment: headlights, taillights, turn signals, mirrors, seat belts, VIN
- State registration required
- Insurance required
- Valid driver's license required

### Geographic Regulations
- Allowed on roads with 35 mph speed limits or less
- Prohibited on highways and interstates
- State-specific rules vary
- Local ordinances may apply
- HOA and community restrictions possible

## CUSTOMER SERVICE KNOWLEDGE BASE

### Common Questions
Q: What is the difference between an NEV and a golf cart?
A: NEVs are street-legal vehicles with DOT-required safety features, while golf carts are designed for off-road use only.

Q: How far can an NEV travel on a single charge?
A: Range varies by model, typically 40-60 miles per charge depending on terrain and usage.

Q: Can I drive an NEV on the highway?
A: No, NEVs are limited to roads with speed limits of 35 mph or less.

Q: What maintenance does an NEV require?
A: Minimal maintenance - mainly tire pressure, brake checks, and battery care. Annual service recommended.

Q: Are NEVs good in winter?
A: Yes, with optional weather enclosures. Battery performance may decrease slightly in extreme cold.

### Customer Demographics
- Age: 35-75 (primary market)
- Income: $50,000-$150,000+ household income
- Location: Suburban, retirement communities, resort areas, college towns
- Use Cases: Short-distance commuting, neighborhood travel, campus transport, resort mobility

## MARKET INTELLIGENCE FOR AI TRAINING

### Industry Trends
- Growing demand for eco-friendly transportation
- Increased urban density driving short-range vehicle needs
- Retirement community growth expanding NEV market
- Campus sustainability initiatives
- Rising gas prices increasing electric vehicle interest
- Municipal fleet electrification

### Competitive Landscape
- Golf cart manufacturers expanding into NEV market
- Traditional automotive companies exploring low-speed EVs
- Chinese manufacturers entering US market
- Price competition from imports
- Quality differentiation important

### Pricing Strategy
- Entry-level models: $8,000-$12,000
- Mid-range models: $12,000-$18,000
- Premium models: $18,000-$25,000
- Fleet discounts: 10-20% for 5+ vehicles
- Seasonal promotions: Spring and Fall
